# Pull Request

## Description

<!-- Briefly describe what this PR changes and why -->

Closes #<!-- issue number, or remove this line if not applicable -->

## Checklist for submission

- [ ] GitHub Actions are passing
- [ ] I have added relevant tests (or explain why tests aren't needed)
- [ ] I have considered if an ADR is required for any architectural decisions
- [ ] Documentation has been updated if needed (README, comments, etc.)
- [ ] The PR does not exceed 500 lines of code (excluding config files or data changes)

## To the reviewer

When doing a review, please follow [the GDS approach](https://gds-way.digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk/manuals/code-review-guidelines.html#how-to-review-code).

For this PR, please focus on:

<!-- Select the appropriate review level -->
- [ ] A comprehensive review according to the [ONS DuckBook standards](https://best-practice-and-impact.github.io/qa-of-code-guidance/checklist_lower.html#template-checklist)
- [ ] A review of the process or maths being sensible
- [ ] A code review for:
    - code implementation (does the code do what it says it does)
    - documentation (is it easy to understand what the code is trying to do)
    - tests (is the code being tested for edge cases, unexpected inputs, and normal operation)
